segment.source: How to: port a simple OpenGL ES 2.0 renderer to Direct3D 11.1
segment.target: How to: port a simple OpenGL ES 2.0 renderer to Direct3D 11.1

segment.source: For the first porting exercise, we'll start with the basics: bringing a simple renderer for a spinning, vertex-shaded cube from OpenGL ES 2.0 into Direct3D, such that it matches the DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) template from Visual Studio 2015.
segment.target: For the first porting exercise, we'll start with the basics: bringing a simple renderer for a spinning, vertex-shaded cube from OpenGL ES 2.0 into Direct3D, such that it matches the DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) template from Visual Studio 2015.
